item.title: TLDR; Graph Contrastive Learning: Representation Scattering
item.description: Source Link to heading Paper link: https://openreview.net/pdf?id=R8SolCx62K Source Code: https://github.com/hedongxiao-tju/SGRL Abstract Link to heading Contrastive Learning (CL) is one of my favorite techniques, it is a self-supervised approach for learning latent representations with a special property: Similar elements have representations that are closer together and elements that are different are farther from each other. The paper: Exploitation of a Latent Mechanism in Graph Contrastive Learning Representation Scattering takes a very novel approach to CL and it gives a nice theoretical foundation of CL and Graph!
